confirmDialog.defaultMessage: Are you sure you want to do that ?

langSelect.label: System language
langSelect.help: This options allows you to choose the language of your Recalbox.

keyboardSelect.label: Keyboard layout
keyboardSelect.help: This option allows you to choose your keyboard layout.

timeZoneSelect.label: Timezone
timeZoneSelect.help: This option allows you to choose your time zone.

help.availableOptions: This option allows you to specify the external screen to use.
help.0: You can find more informations in the following page: https://wiki.recalbox.com/en/tutorials/video/display-configuration/external-screen-configuration

help.availableOptions: This option allows you to specify the resolution to force.
help.0: You can find more informations in the following page: https://wiki.recalbox.com/en/tutorials/video/display-configuration/external-screen-configuration

help.availableOptions: This option allows you to specify the frequency to force.
help.0: You can find more informations in the following page: https://wiki.recalbox.com/en/tutorials/video/display-configuration/external-screen-configuration

enabled.label: Enable splash screen
enabled.help: This option allows you to enable or disable splash screens.

help.availableOptions: This option allows you to choose the play duration of splash screen videos. Available options (in seconds):
help.0: 0 : Video will be stopped when emulationstation is ready to start
help.1: -1 : All the video will be played before emulationstation start (default)
help.2: > 0 : Time the video will be played before emulationstation start

help.availableOptions: This option allows you to choose which splash screen you would like to use.. Available options:
This option allows you to block access to emulator menus with Hotkey + B. Available options:
help.default: default is the default behaviour with all options.

enabled.label: Check for updates at startup
enabled.help: This option allows you to ask to your Recalbox to verify if an update exists at startup.

debuglogs.title: Debug
debuglogs.label: Enable debug mode
debuglogs.help:
This option allows you to enable or disable the debug mode.

If you don't need to use the debug mode, please disable it. This option can extremely slow down your game experience.

brightness.title: Brightness
brightness.label: Power of the brightness
brightness.help: This option allows you to define the brightness of the screen. Only usable an Anbernic RG353 and Odroid Go Advance.

minitft.title: Mini TFT screen
minitft.label: Enable fbcp
minitft.help: This option allows you to enable or disable the Framebuffer Copy Program (fbcp).

help.availableOptions: This option allows you to choose power switch. Available options:
help.5: PIN56ONOFF corresponds to an on-off button between GPIO3 and ground.
help.6: PIN56PUSH corresponds to a pression button between GPIO3 and ground.
help.7: PIN356ONOFFRESET corresponds to an on-off button between GPIO2 and ground.
help.8: PIN356PUSHRESET corresponds to a pression button between GPIO3 and ground.

managerEnabled.label: Enables manager
managerEnabled.help: This option allows you to enable or disable this web manager.

sambaEnabled.label: Enables Samba
sambaEnabled.help: This option allows you to enable or disable Samba protocol.

virtualGamepadsEnabled.label: Enables virtual devices
virtualGamepadsEnabled.help: This option allows you to enable or disable virtual devices (controller / keyboard / touchpad).

sshEnabled.label: Enables SSH protocol
sshEnabled.help: This option allows you to enable or disable SSH protocol.

time.label: Delay
time.help: This option allows you to choose the delay before screensaver start, in seconds. Default: 5 minutes

help.availableOptions: This option allows you to choose the screensaver type. Available options:
help.demo: demo launches a random game as demo.
help.gameclip: gameclip shows a random game clip video from scrap.

systemlist.label: Displayed systems list (demo / gameclip)
systemlist.help: This option allows you to set the system list from which ES will run random games. Empty list or unexisting key means all available systems.

duration.label: Demo duration ( 30 à 600 s )
duration.help: This option allows you to define execution time of game demos. Default value: 90s.

infoscreenduration.label: Info screen duration ( 15 à 30 s )
infoscreenduration.help: This option allows you to define the display time about informations screen of game demos. Default value: 6s.

showhelpitems.label: Display buttons at the bottom of game clips
showhelpitems.help: This option allows you to hide visible action buttons at the bottom of the game clips.

showclippingitem.label: Display "Press Start" on game clips
showclippingitem.help: This option allows you to display "Press Start" at the center of the screen.

enabled.label: Enable fan
enabled.help: This option allows you to enable fan on your board folling specific hat. If you are using a hat like the RGB Dual, you can't use this option.

help.availableOptions: This option allows you to choose which hat to use. If you are using a hat like the RGB Dual, you can't use this option. Available options:
help.1: argonforty corresponds to the board in Argon One cases.
help.2: piboy corresponds to Experimental Pi PiBoy boards.
help.3: rpipoeplus corresponds to Raspberry Pi PoE+ board.
help.4: fanshim corresponds to Pimoroni fan SHIM board.

enabled.label: Enable second mini TFT screen
enabled.help: This option allows you to enable or disable a secod mini TFT screen.

help.availableOptions: This option allows you tochoose the type of mini TFT screen. Available options:
help.0: overlay corresponds to a configuration via /boot/config.txt or /boot/config.ini following board.

help.availableOptions: This option allows you to choose resolution of the mini TFT screen. Available options:

imagestretchenabled.label: Enable image stretch
imagestretchenabled.help: This option allows you to enable or disable image stretch.

imageenlargeenabled.label: Enable image enlarge
imageenlargeenabled.help: This option allows you to enable or disable to enlarge image to fill the whole screen.

imagealphaenabled.label: Enable alpha channel
imagealphaenabled.help: This option allows you to enable or disable the usage of alpha channel if appropriate.

imageignoreaspectenabled.label: Enable ignore image aspect
imageignoreaspectenabled.help: This option allows you to enable or disable the possibility to ignore image aspect.

disablevideoines.label: Disable video scraps
disablevideoines.help: This option allows you to enable or disable the possibility to play scrap videos on the second mini TFT screen.

backlightcontrol.label: Contrôle de la luminosité
backlightcontrol.help: Cette option vous permet de contrôler la luminosité du mini écran TFT. Pour pouvoir l'utiliser, votre écran doit être géré par un PWM.

usemarquee.label: Use marquees
usemarquee.help: This option allows you to enable or disable usage of marquees.

sleepenabled.label: Enable sleep mode
sleepenabled.help: This option allows you to enable or disable sleep mode.

backgroundMusic.title: Background music
backgroundMusic.help: This option allows you to enable or disable background musics. You need to restart EmulationStation to activate this feature

volume.title: Volume
volume.help: This option allows you to modify the volume.

volume.title: Music volume
volume.help: This option allows you to modify the music volume.

audioOutput.title: Audio output
audioOutput.help: This option allows you to select the audio output.

help.title: This option allows you to select the sound to listen in menus. Available options:
help.0: musicxorvideosound will play musics or video sounds.
help.1: musicandvideosound will play musics and video sounds.
help.4: none will play no music or video sound.

hostname.label: Hostname
hostname.help: This option allows you to define the name of your Recalbox on your local network.

wifi.title: Wi-Fi

region.title: Wifi country code
region.help: The default value is JP because this country is the most permissive for wifi.

ip.title: Recalbox IP address
ip.help: This option allows you to specify an IP address for your Recalbox.

netmask.title: Netmask
netmask.help: This option allows you to specify a netmask for your Recalbox.

gateway.title: Gateway IP address
gateway.help: This option allows you to specify a gateway IP address for your Recalbox.

nameservers.title: Domain name server(s)
nameservers.help: This option allows you to specify one or multiple IP addresses of domain name servers. Each Ip address must be separated by a space.

priority.title: Priority
priority.help: This option allows you to edit the priority of your wifi connection.

wifi.help:
Please note: any misconfiguration would lead to your recalbox being unavailable on the network.

The passwords are encrypted and are not re-displayed. This does not mean that the fields are emtpy! If you enter a new value, it will overwrite the old one.

ssid.title: SSID
ssid.help: This option allows you to fill the name of your wifi connection.

key.title: Key
key.help: This option allows you to fill the associated password of your wifi connection.

videomode.label: Video mode
videomode.help: This option allows you to choose a resolution screen for your Recalbox. There are two groups of video modes: CEA and DMT. Make sure the mode is compatible with your native screen resolution.

force43.label: Force 4/3 format
force43.help: This option allows you to choose if you like to force the frontend to display in 4/3 format.

help.availableOptions: This option allows you to choose menus access to make available to players. Available options:
help.bartop: bartop has filtered options, suitable for bartops.
help.none: none just lets you select games. With this option, you will not have the shut down option available !

systemSelectedAsDefault.label: System selected as default
systemSelectedAsDefault.help: This option allows you to choose which system will be selected at startup.

startFromFirstSystem.label: Start on the list of games from the first system (or the one selected)
startFromFirstSystem.help: This option allows you to choose if you would like to start directly in game list from the first system (or the one selected).

disableSystemSelection.label: Disable the system selection
disableSystemSelection.help: This option allows you to choose if you would liek to start and display ONLY the first system (or the one selected).

quickSystemSelect.label: Enable quick system selection
quickSystemSelect.help: This option allows you to enable or disable quick system selection.

help.availableOptions: This option allows you to sort systems. Available options:
help.3: 1type2name sorts by type then by name.
help.4: 1type2releasedate sorts by type then release date.
help.5: 1manufacturer2name sorts by manufacturer then by name.
help.6: 1manufacturer2releasedate sorts by manufacturer then by release date.
help.7: 1type2manufacturer3name sorts by type, then by manufacturer and by name.
help.8: 1type2manufacturer3releasedate sorts by type, then by manufacturer and by release date.

showOnlyScrapedGames.label: Show only scraped games
showOnlyScrapedGames.help: This option allows you to display only games included in the gamelist.xml files (accelerates display times).

clock.label: Display clock
clock.help: This option allows you to display a clock in menus.

showonlylatestversion.label: Only show latest version (bêta)
showonlylatestversion.help: This option allows you to enable or disable showing more recent version of a game.

favoritesonly.label: Show only favorites
favoritesonly.help: This option allows you to enable or disable showing only favorites in each system.

showhidden.label: Show hidden games
showhidden.help: This option allows you to enable or disable showing hidden games in each system.

filteradultgames.label: Hide adult games
filteradultgames.help: This option allows you to enable or disable showing games recognized as adult games in each system.

hidepreinstalledgames.label: Hide preinstalled games
hidepreinstalledgames.help: This option allows you to enable or disable showing preinstalled games.

hidenogames.label: Hide no games
hidenogames.help: This option allows you to enable or disable showing elements which are not recognized as games (bios, etc.).

delay.label: Delay
delay.help: This option allows you to define delay before videosnaps start, in milliseconds. Default: 2s ( 2000 ).

help.availableOptions: This option allows you to define the number of times videoscraps are looping (default: 1). Available options:
help.0: If you define this to 0, no video will be played.
help.1: If you define this to 1 or more, the video loops x times before fading out.

allgames.label: Enable All games
allgames.help: This option allows you to enable or disable All games virtual system.

multiplayer.label: Enable Multiplayer
multiplayer.help: This option allows you to enable or disable Multiplayers virtual system.

lastplayed.label: Enable Last played
lastplayed.help: This option allows you to enable or disable Last played virtual system.

lightgun.label: Disable Lightgun
lightgun.help: This option allows you to enable or disable Lightgun virtual system.

ports.label: Hide Ports
ports.help: This option allows you to enable or disable Ports virtual system.

tate.label: Enable Tate
tate.help: This option allows you to enable or disable Tate virtual system.

tateonly.label: Display only tate games in gamelists
tateonly.help: This option allows you to enable or disable to display only tate games in gamelists.

folder.label: Theme selection
folder.help: This option allows you to select which theme to apply.

help.availableOptions: This option allows you to define transition style on game start. Available options:
help.0: fade does a fade screen turning black.
help.1: slide will zoom to the game image (or its name if there is no data).
help.2: instant will launch game without any animation.

help.availableOptions: This option allows you to choose the animation performed while moving across systems. Available options:
help.0: If enabled, transition between systems will be smooth.
help.1: If disabled, transition between systems will be instant.

showhelp.label: Display help
showhelp.help: This option allows you to enable or disable help popups.

help.label: Durée d'affichage de la popup d'aide
help.help: This option allows you to change the help popup display time period.

music.label: Durée d'affichage de la popup de musique
music.help: This option allows you to change the music popup display time period.

netplay.label: Durée d'affichage de la popup de netplay
netplay.help: This option allows you to change the netplay popup display time period.

help.availableOptions: This option allows you to choose how you would like to get game names. Available options:

media.title: Picture type
media.help: This option allows you to choose if you would like to download a picture type.

thumbnail.title: Thumbnail type
thumbnail.help: This option allows you to choose if you would like to download a thumbnail type.

video.title: Video type
video.help: This option allows you to choose if you would like to download a video type.

maps.title: Maps download
maps.help: This option allows you to choose if you would like to download maps.

manual.title: Manuals download
manual.help: This option allows you to choose if you would like to download manuals.

p2k.title: PAD to keyboard configurations download
p2k.help: This option allows you to choose if you would like to download pad2keyboard configurations.

user.title: User
user.help: This option allows you to fill your username of your ScreenScraper account.

password.title: Password
password.help: This option allows you to fill your associated password of your ScreenScraper account.

language.title: Favorite language
language.help: This option allows you to select the language to use for your scraps.

region.title: Favorite region
region.help: This option allows you to select your favorite region.

help.title: This option allows you to choose the region to use. Available options:

enableKodi.label: Enable Kodi
enableKodi.help: This option allows you to enable or disable Kodi.

kodiAtStartup.label: Launch Kodi at startup
kodiAtStartup.help: This option allows you to enable or disable automatic Kodi launch at startup

launchWithX.label: Key X starts Kodi
launchWithX.help: This option allows you to enable or disable the possibility to access to Kodi with the X button from a SNES controller.

options.label: Select mode
options.help: This option allows you to choose a resolution for Kodi.

help.availableOptions: This option allows you to edit the wait mode at Kodi startup. Available options:
help.required: required Kodi does not launch before being able to reach the specified IP address.
help.wish: wish uses a countdown timer before starting.

waitTime.label: Wait time
waitTime.help: This option allows you to define the waiting time (seconds) before Kodi startup fails ("required") or continue ("wish").

waitHost.label: IP Address
waitHost.help: This option allows you to define an IP address which must be reached to validate its availibility.

enableHyperion.label: Enable Hyperion
enableHyperion.help:
This option allows you to enable or disable Hyperion

This feature is actually not available in Recalbox, it will be back as soon as possible.

ratio.label: Screen ratio
ratio.help: This option allows you to choose the ratio adapted to your screen. Default: "auto".

videomode.label: Video mode
videomode.help: This option allows you to apply a specific screen resolution. There are two groups of video modes: CEA and DMT. Make sure the mode is compatible with your native screen resolution.

shaders.label: Enable shaders
shaders.help: This option allows you to enable or disable shader use.

help.availableShaders: This option allows you to choose if you would like to use a defined shaderset or a custom shader. Available shaders:
help.retro: retro sets the "best" shader for each system, as chosen by the community. This will give you the gaming experience closest to the original system.
help.crtcurved: crtcurved uses shaders with a light round to recreate CRT screens.
help.custom: custom allows you to choose and activate a custom shader.

customshaders.label: Custom shader
customshaders.help: This option allows you, you you selected to use a custom shader, to choose a shader to use.

integerscale.label: Enables pixel perfect
integerscale.help: This option allows you to enable or disable pixel perfect image scaling. Activating the "Pixel Perfect" image scaling mode which is to get the exact rendering of the games on a modern screen.

smooth.title: Smooth game
smooth.label: Enables game smoothing
smooth.help: This option allows you to make your games more smooth.

recalboxoverlays.label: Recalbox Overlays
recalboxoverlays.help: This option allows you to enable or disable default overlays.

showfps.label: Display frequency
showfps.help: This option allows you to display frequency in menus and in game.

autosave.label: Enables automatic backup / load
autosave.help:
This option allows you to create an automatic backup of your game when you exit it, then to load it again when you restart it.

Once the game is launched and the backup loaded, if you want to return to the title screen of the game, use the special reset command.

showsavestatebeforerun.label: Show save states on start
showsavestatebeforerun.help: This option will show available save states before a game is launched.

quitpresstwice.label: Press twice to quit game
quitpresstwice.help: This option allows you to enable or disable the possibility to press twice Hotkey + Start to quit a game.

enabled.label: Enable boot on game
enabled.help: This option allows you to enable or disable the possibility to launch automatically a specific game on boot. Note: If Kodi is also defined to boot, Kodi have the priority.

help.availableOptions: This option allows you to define the rotation of the game screen of tate games. Available options:
help.0: 0 will left you games as is.
help.1: 1 will turn game screen 90° to the left.
help.2: 2 will turn upside down game screen.
help.3: 3 will turn game screen 90° to the right.

activate.label: Enables "Arcade" meta system
activate.help: Activate the Arcade metasystem to group all games from piFBA, FBN (libretro), MAME and optionally Neogeo into a single "Arcade" system.

includeNeogeo.label: Include Neogeo
includeNeogeo.help: Include NeoGeo or not in the meta system "Arcade".

hideOriginals.label: Hide originals systems
hideOriginals.help: Hide included system or leave them in the system list.

manufacturers.label: Manufacturer Virtual Systems
manufacturers.help: This option allows you to choose manufacturers to have their own systems.

enhanced.label: Enable enhanced view
enhanced.help: This option allows you to enable or disable the enhanced view in arcade view.

hideclones.label: Fold clones by default
hideclones.help: This option allows you to enable or disable the possibility to auto-fold clones.

hidebios.label: Hide bios
hidebios.help: This option allows you to enable or disable the possibility to hide bios files.

hidenonworking.label: Hide non-working games
hidenonworking.help: This option allows you to enable or disable the possibility to hide non-working games.

usedatabasenames.label: Always use official names
usedatabasenames.help: This option allows you to enable or disable the use of official names.

translate.label: Enables automatic Retroarch translation
translate.help: This option allows you to enable automatic translation. You need to have an account at https://ztranslate.net/ to be able to use this feature.

translateFrom.label: Source language
translateFrom.help: This option allows you to define the source language that may speed up or give more accurate results.

translateTo.label: Target language
translateTo.help: This option allows you to choose the original language of texts to translate. The default value is extracted from system language or, if system language is undefined, set to auto (EN).

translateApiKey.label: zTranslate API Key
translateApiKey.help:
This option allows you to add you API translation key. You need to go to https://ztranslate.net and create an account if you don't have one yet.

validate your account, then log in and go to the settings page and get the API Key at the bottom.

translateUrl.label: Other translation service URL
translateUrl.help:
This option allows you to indicate if you would like to use another translation system. If you want to use another translation service or a custom API call, use this key to specify the url to call.

If the key is not empty, it is used instead of zTranslation's API Key.

rewind.title: Rewind
rewind.label: Enables rewind
rewind.help: This option allows you to rewind the game whilst playing. This can slowdown some emulators (snes, psx) if you enable it and doesn't work with all emulators.

help.availableOptions: This option allows you to patch a game on-the-fly, without modifying your roms. Available options:
help.0: auto will apply only 1 patch everytime automatically.
help.1: select will ask you to choose one or more patche(s) to apply if you would like.
help.2: disable will ignore completely patches if it exist.
help.3: launchLast will use the selected patch in the game options.

activate.label: Enable RetroAchievements
activate.help:
This option allows you to enable or disable usage of Retroachievements. RetroAchievements.org is a community website that allows you to win custom-made achievements for retro games.

Achievements are made by and for the community.

hardcore.label: Enable Hardcore mode
hardcore.help:
This option allows you to enable or disable hardcore mode. Once enabled, the Hardcore mode deactivates all possibilities of saving in the emulator! You won't be able to save or reload your game whilst playing.

You have to complete the game and get the achievements first time, just like it was on the original console.

username.label: Login
username.help: This option allows you to fill your login of your Retroachievements account.

password.label: Password
password.help: This option allows you to fill your associated password to your Retroachievements account.

activate.label: Enables netplay
activate.help:
This option allows you to enable or disable Netplay.

Netplay is a feature allowing networked multiplayer mode with some emulators via peer-to-peer (P2P) networking.

nickname.label: Nickname
nickname.help:
This option allows you to configure your nickname.

Be careful not to put any special or accentued characters, this prevents the operation of Netplay.

port.label: Port
port.help: This option allows you to define another port to connect to Netplay. Default value: 55435

relay.label: Netplay MITM Server relay
relay.help:
This option allows you to choose a relay server to connect to Netplay.

The Netplay MITM, Relay Server option allows you to override the opening of your modem ports.
This allows both sides of the connection to be routed through an intermediary server.

However this will have an impact on the speed at which the data synchronizes and therefore on the responsiveness of the game.

lobby.label: Libretro lobby
lobby.help:
This option allows you to define another address for the Netplay lobby.

URL of the libretro lobby list to use.

The URL "http://lobby.libretro.com/list/" is configured by default.

remove.text: Are you sure you want to delete this BIOS?

tooltips.yellow: Optional BIOS not present or wrong MD5
tooltips.red: Mandatory BIOS not present or wrong MD5

redFilter.label: Filter not present or wrong MD5 mandatory BIOS

orangeFilter.label: Filter not present or wrong MD5 optional BIOS

yellow_1.title: Optional present BIOS + wrong MD5
yellow_1.text: It may work, but since no one from us has tested it, we can't guarantee anything.

yellow_2.title: Optionnal missing BIOS
yellow_2.text: It can work, as long as you don't use a game or a feature that requires this optional bios

red.title: Mandatory missing BIOS or wrong MD5

remove.text: Are you sure you want to delete this ROM?

enabled.label: Bluetooth controllers support
enabled.help: This option allows you to enable or disable support of Bluetooth controllers.

ertm.label: ERTM protocol activation
ertm.help: This option allows you to enable or disable support of ERTM protocol.

autopaironboot.label: Auto-pair on boot
autopaironboot.help: This option allows you to enable or disable auto-pairing on boot.

enabled.label: DB9 controllers support
enabled.help: This option allows you to enable or disable support of DB9 controllers.

settings.label: Settings
settings.help: This option allows you to enable or disable DB9 controllers.

enabled.label: Always show pad OSD
enabled.help: This option allows you to enable or disable pad OSD everywhere or not.

type.label: Pad OSD type
type.help: This option allows you to choose the pad to display for the OSD.

enabled.label: Gamecon controllers support
enabled.help: This option allows you to enable or disable support of Gamecon controllers.

settings.label: Settings
settings.help: This option allows you to enable or disable Gamecon controllers.

enabled.label: GPIO controllers support
enabled.help: This option allows you to enable or disable support of GPIO controllers.

settings.label: Settings
settings.help: This option allows you to enable or disable GPIO controllers.

enabled.label: PS3 controllers support
enabled.help: This option allows you to enable or disable support of Bluetooth controllers.

driver.label: Driver to use
driver.help: This option allows you to enable or disable support of Bluetooth controllers.

enabled.label: Steam controllers support
enabled.help: This option allows you to enable or disable support of Steam controllers.

enabled.label: XArcade Tankstik and compatible controllers support
enabled.help: This option allows you to enable or disable support of XArcade Tankstik controllers and compatibles.

enabled.label: Joycon controllers support
enabled.help: This option allows you to enable or disable support of Joycon controllers.

enabled.label: Invert validate and cancel buttons
enabled.help: This option allows you to invert validate and cancel buttons.

help.availableOptions: Available options:

remove.text: Are you sure you want to delete this media?

privatekey.label: Key
privatekey.help: This option allows you to fill your Patreon key provided on www.recalbox.com.

source.label: Scrap source
source.help: If you are boss level 2 or 3, This option allows you to choose the source of your scraps.

auto.label: Enable auto-scrap
auto.help: This option allows you to enable or disable auto-scrap.

enable.label: Enable patrons playlist
enable.help: This option allows you to disable music playlist.
